stem:
A 68-year-old male was admitted 2 hours ago with crushing substernal chest pain radiating to the left jaw and arm. He suddenly develops bradycardia.

Current Assessment:
BP: 82/50 (previous 128/76)
HR: 42 bpm (previous 88 bpm)
RR: 24 breaths/min
SpO2: 92% on 2L NC
ECG: ST elevation in leads II, III, aVF with new second-degree AV block type II
Troponin I: 3.8 ng/mL (normal <0.04)
Client states: "I feel really nauseous and dizzy"
Skin: Cold, clammy, diaphoretic

The provider has ordered nitroglycerin 0.4 mg SL PRN for chest pain. What is the nurse's PRIORITY action?
choices: Administer the nitroglycerin as ordered to relieve chest pain and improve cardiac perfusion
Apply transcutaneous pacing pads immediately and prepare to initiate pacing
Place the client in Trendelenburg position to increase venous return and cardiac output
Administer atropine 0.5 mg IV push to increase the heart rate above 60 bpm
answer: Apply transcutaneous pacing pads immediately and prepare to initiate pacing
rationale: This client has an inferior wall STEMI (ST elevation in II, III, aVF) with development of second-degree AV block type II accompanied by hemodynamic instability (BP dropped from 128/76 to 82/50, symptomatic bradycardia at 42 bpm). Type II blocks are infranodal and can suddenly progress to complete heart block, causing cardiac arrest. Transcutaneous pacing is the priority intervention. CRITICAL: Nitroglycerin is CONTRAINDICATED in inferior MI with suspected right ventricular involvement - it causes venodilation, decreases preload, and will worsen the hypotension. Atropine is ineffective for second-degree type II blocks because the conduction problem is below the AV node.

choice_rationales.Administer the nitroglycerin as ordered: Incorrect - nitroglycerin is contraindicated in RV infarction; will cause severe hypotension
choice_rationales.Apply transcutaneous pacing pads immedia: Correct - second-degree type II block with hemodynamic instability requires immediate pacing
choice_rationales.Place the client in Trendelenburg positi: Incorrect - not effective for cardiogenic hypotension; delays pacing
choice_rationales.Administer atropine 0.5 mg IV push to in: Incorrect - atropine ineffective for type II AV block
